meanings.definition: To create a mental picture or representation of something.
meanings.sent1: She imaged a sunny beach in her mind.
meanings.sent2: He imaged the story as he read the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat imaged itself as a lion in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter imaged a melody in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The artist imaged a world of colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To portray or represent something in a visual form.
meanings.sent1: The painter imaged the mountain with great detail.
meanings.sent2: The camera imaged the landscape beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The child imaged a monster under the bed for fun.
meanings.sent4: The clouds imaged a dragon in the sky at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The screen imaged the scene in vivid colors.

meanings.definition: To reflect or resemble something in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The calm lake imaged the sky above.
meanings.sent2: The mirror imaged her smile perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The building imaged a castle in the distance.
meanings.sent4: The water imaged the trees along the shore.
meanings.sent5: The glass imaged the city lights at night.

meanings.definition: To produce or display an image of something.
meanings.sent1: The printer imaged the document on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The screen imaged the website for all to see.
meanings.sent3: The projector imaged the presentation on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The camera imaged the moment forever.
meanings.sent5: The TV imaged the live event in real-time.
